page.title: 17BRAINS FARM WINCANTON pt 2
page.content: {(Milking cont)}Twelve cows are milked at a time and the whole herd takes about two hours. The milk is stored in bulk tanks until it is taken by tanker to Longman's at Sparkford for{cheese- making. His production quota is half a million litres per year. This part of Somerset has a{temperate climate and the heavy soil is good for growing{grass.}That is why Mr. Cocks likes farming here. He usually expects to put the cows out in mid-April. He begins to make{silage}and{hay}from about mid-May and continues throughout the Summer months. He reseeds where he needs to in August and September. In October the grass stops growing and the cows are fed on silage and concentrates.The cows eat 1\ tonnes of concentrates per year and the bulls consume 1\ tonnes of barley per year. cont
